snippet: The authorities closed the emergency ward of one of the kingdom’s largest hospitals after 46 new cases of Middle East respiratory syndrome appeared.
abstract: Saudi Arabian authorities report largest spike in cases of Middle East respiratory syndrome since it first appeared in kingdom in 2012; medical experts express fears that surge in virus could threaten more than two million visitors expected to arrive in September for annual hajj pilgrimage to Mecca.
lead_paragraph: The authorities closed the emergency ward of one of the kingdom’s largest hospitals after 46 new cases of Middle East respiratory syndrome appeared.

headline.main: New Surge of MERS Infections Hits Saudi Arabia
headline.print_headline: New Surge in Cases of MERS for Saudis
